intro: Ononis cephalantha subsp. pseudocephalantha, commonly known as the western sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has hairy, narrow leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. This subspecies is adapted to thrive in disturbed or open habitats, making it a common sight in coastal dunes and dry slopes.
